page.title: 14Landscape Chaldon Hills
page.content: Apart from the Army Camp (see Armed Forces) the dominant groups of buildings in the landscape are associated with agriculture. The older farm buildings are built of local materials. Drove Dairy, one of the modern buildings is a typical 1980's design of steel frame with low-level block and high-level slatted timber cladding and a corrugated asbestos roof. Other modern buildings can be found at Burngate, Newlands and West Down. Winfrith Down, Sleight and Vines Down buildings, Marley Wood Barn, Burngate Farm and Belhuish Farm are examples of post-enclosure farmsteads. These are now integrated into holdings but were originally built with local materials, as individual units following the Act of Enclosure of 1768.
